results.title: Autism : The Early Signs
results.brief_description: This video comes with an education kit produced by the Autistic Family Support Association. Together they promote the early detection and diagnosis of autism in young children. The video is a visual representation of the behavioural characteristics of autism, and, through three case studies, shows the difficulties arising from living with a child who appears normal but whose behaviour is disturbing. Most importantly, it stresses the role of parents, people working with young children and health professionals in picking up the first clues that a child may be autistic.

results.title: Authority and rebellion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This specially edited version of the film adapted from Herman Wouk’s The Caine Mutiny explores the first half of the novel - the events leading up to the mutiny. As in the novel, the film focuses on a young naval officer who has been taught to revere authority, but faced with an authority that has abnegated its responsibilities, goes along with the rebellion.

results.title: Australians because of business
results.brief_description: A comprehensive two part program examining the successes and failures of the Australian Business Migration Program. The first part examines the history of the ABMP which was set up in the early 1980’s to entice successful entrepreneurs to Australia. Seventy percent of applicants to the ABMP were from Taiwan and Hong Kong and two years into their residency in Australia, close to half the applicants were still not involved in creating business opportunities for themselves in their new country. The second part of the program examines some of the problems encountered by business migrants including language difficulty, encountering a different commercial culture in Australia and negotiating an indifferent government bureaucracy.

results.title: Australians at the Olympics
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Southern Latitude Films and National Panasonic
results.brief_description: Based on the book by sports journalist Gary Lester, the program is hosted by Olympic Gold medal winner John Konrads. Covers Australian competitors in Olympics from Athens in 1896 to Moscow in 1980. Rare footage is seen and some interviews with Australian champions such as Betty Cuthbert, Hubert Opperman, Dawn Fraser and others.

results.title: Australian wool textile industry
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Australian Woollen and Worsted Manufacturers Association
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the processes involved in the manufacture of woollen and worsted fabrics. Shows sorting of wool according to length and thickness; scouring; carding; dyeing; drawing and spinning; weaving and finishing; also detection and mending of flaws in the finished material. Explains the work done by the machines involved in drawing, spinning and weaving, and compares English and French machines with those used in Australian factories. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian women: their history and achievements
results.brief_description: Australia’s women’s history from 1788 to the present has been a time of enormous change for Aboriginal women, Australian-born and migrant women, working-class and middleclass, in war time and in peace. This video explores the changes in the lives of these women throughout history - changes brought about by economic conditions, legislation, immigration, education, war, the pill and women’s liberation.
